meanings.definition: To release or open (a latch or lock)
meanings.sent1: I carefully unhasped the gate to let the dog out.
meanings.sent2: She unhasped the suitcase to reveal her belongings.
meanings.sent3: The magician unhasped the mysterious box to reveal a fluffy bunny inside!
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, he unhasped the secrets of the ancient chest.
meanings.sent5: The hero unhasped the enchanted door, revealing a world of magic beyond.

meanings.definition: To unfasten or undo (something that is closed or secured)
meanings.sent1: He struggled to unhasp the stubborn buckle on his backpack.
meanings.sent2: The child unhasped the clasp on the necklace to play with it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel cleverly unhasped the bird feeder to steal some seeds.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had unhasped a treasure chest of memories when she found the old photo album.
meanings.sent5: The detective finally unhasped the mystery, revealing the true culprit.
